body_html:
Hi @ezyang - I don't think magma is installed - I just used the binary conda install as per quick start:
conda install pytorch-nightly cuda92 -c pytorch

It was on an "empty" miniconda so no other packages other than the pytorch dependencies were installed.

While the delay is happening I can see that Cuda's JIT compiler is running as it's writing to ~/.nv.

body:
Hi @ezyang - I don't think magma is installed - I just used the binary conda install as per quick start:
conda install pytorch-nightly cuda92 -c pytorch

It was on an "empty" miniconda so no other packages other than the pytorch dependencies were installed.

While the delay is happening I can see that Cuda's JIT compiler is running as it's writing to ~/.nv.
